candidates.title: Improve build log terminal output.
candidates.body:
This PR improves readability of build log output in the terminal by maintaining a rotating window of max 10 messages coming from `cargo` subprocess. This will show both stdout and stderr as it arrives which will improve user experience

Follow up for #5171

candidates.title: Fix segfault in cargo-casper
candidates.body: This will properly fix the segfault that was falsely fixed in previous PR

candidates.title: Convert u128 to u64
candidates.body: Regarding #5197

candidates.title: Update cargo casper
candidates.body:
Follow up for #5171 

This addresses a few minor annoyances

- The SDK has relevant code to create a JSON schema, and that's what's passed to `cargo-casper` (instead of multiple different exported functions). This should fix alleged panics due to memory issues that @igor-casper reported
- Extracting schema from the contract code works on macOS as well
- Fixed clippy issues

candidates.title: CI Publish Updates
candidates.body:
## Artifacts publish

Added persistence to `https://genesis.casper.network/artifacts/casper-node` for each merge to `feat-*`, `release-*`, and `dev` branches.

`https://genesis.casper.network/artifacts/casper-node/[branch_name].latest` holds the git-hash of the commit being stored as artifacts.

Artifacts are referenced by git_hash, so this file provides the latest reference for each branch.  

`https://genesis.casper.network/artifacts/casper-node/<git_hash>/version.json` holds all information needed to pull other files:

```json
{
  "branch": "feat-ci-publish",
  "version": "2.0.0",
  "protocol_version": "2_0_0",
  "git-hash": "b52aad61f7b7025aa5a0582b486059fd265af3d3",
  "timestamp": "2025-03-26T20:54:45Z",
  "files": "[\"bin.tar.gz\",\"config.tar.gz\",\"global-state-update-gen_0.3.0_amd64.deb\"]"
}
```

## Crates.io publish

Crates.io publish moved over from drone to github actions on tag.

## global-state-update-gen debian publish.

Updated to use new repo.casper.network infra.

candidates.title: Initial implementation of gas cost metering
candidates.body:
This PR implements cycle-based gas cost accounting.

The model used here slightly deviates from the approach used for  wasmi. When the same model was used to capture overhead of metering in opcode multipliers, it turned out that tests with the real life wasm compute-intensive code lowered the available compute time by a factor of 10. This is due to non-linear overhead of the metering middleware used in wasmer. 

To better account for the overhead of metering middleware in Wasm compiled to native code, instead, a cycle count is derived from the benchmarks, a static multiplier is computed equal for each opcode, and then a static scaling factor is used.

The cost of executing an opcode under wasmer is equal to \$k * \frac{M}{F}\$ where
- \$k\$ is the cycle count for the given opcode
- \$M\$ is a multiplier derived from benchmarks and calculated for max gas/block time limits.
- \$F\$ is a scaling factor to counter the effects of non-linear overhead of the metering middleware, validated manually by running compute-intensive real-world Wasm. A positive value will increase available computation time, negative would decrease available computation time.

Closes #4995

candidates.title: [New VM] Make cargo-casper usable
candidates.body:
Adds CLI utility for the new vm contracts:
- `build_schema`, generates a contract schema json
- `build`, builds the contract with its schema embedded and exposed through an entrypoint (this behavior is opt-out)
- `new`, creates a new contract from template

Run with `--help` to get more information.

candidates.title: Disable default features in the prometheus crate
candidates.body:
Disables the default features in `prometheus` to prevent the `protobuf` crate from being compiled into the node. This is in response to the recent [2024-0437 RUSTSEC](https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2024-0437) entry.

Note that we seemingly never needed this functionality in the first place, so it only affects the auditing.

candidates.title: Bumping versions needed for crates publish.
candidates.body:
Addresses #5121 

Most components were previously bumped. 
Bumped EE related and casper-contracts.

candidates.title: Port messages API for new Virtual Machine
Charge for host functions in VM2
candidates.body: Resolves #4996 by charging gas for calling VM2 host functions. These costs are defined under ``wasm.v2.host_function_costs`` in the chainspec. Storage costs are also taken into consideration.

candidates.title: Update toolchain to 1.84.1
candidates.body:
This PR updates toolchain to a current stable rust toolchain version 1.84.1. This contains all necessary clippy fixes for new lints since 1.78.0. With these lints fixed it should be straightforward to go to 1.85, 1.86, and higher in the future (unless there are more radical changes, and bunch more clippy lints.

This is something I encountered while working on #4993 when I had to bump the major version to 1.80.0  I didn't want to pollute the other PR with random clippy fixes.

candidates.title: Bump dependencies
candidates.body: This PR bumps wasm parser to 0.46.1

candidates.title: Bump OpenSSL version
candidates.body: Bumps the OpenSSL version to 0.10.70 in both ``node`` and ``types`` crates.

candidates.title: Making a series of fixes to binary port:
candidates.body:
* Removed the dedicated "keepalive" request
* Removed `protocol_version` from `BinaryRequestHeader` and `BinaryResponseHeader`
* Added `binary_response_version` to `BinaryResponseHeader`
* Changed value of `BINARY_REQUEST_VERSION` from 0 to 1
* Changed the mechanism of determining if the connection should be closed due to idleness - from now on different kinds of requests give different amounts of time for the connection to live. The amounts of time per request type is specified in config file
* Changed BinaryPort so that `new` is a pure constructor and all the fallible code is in the initialization process since that is the go-to way of handling component initialization
* Renamed BinaryRequest to Command
* changed BinaryResponseAndRequest so it holds responses requests raw bytes instead of derived structure
* Removed `protocol_version` from `EraValidatorsRequest` and `SeigniorageRecipientsRequest` because they were not used in the codebase.
* other, minor fixes

Please consider the following when creating a PR:

This PR will affect sidecar and binary-port-client

candidates.title: GH-5053: Remove unmaintained test contract
candidates.body:
This PR removes unmaintained old test-contract for VM2 together with few cleanups

Closes #5053

candidates.title: GH-5058: Handle payment fix
candidates.body:
This change fixes custom payment under `Transaction::Deploy` variant which incorrectly took session bytes, rather than payment field. Additionally, it does properly remove the named key when payment is finalized.

Closes #5058

candidates.title: CI update for GitHub actions in test.
candidates.body:
Drone to github actions for pr/pull
Cleanup of AS from Makefile
Removal of nightly from drone

candidates.title: GH-5039: Tweak costs and chainspec settings
candidates.body:
Closes #5039 

This PR adds a gas charge for calling a non-existing system contract entry point. Additionally, some charges for incorrectly charged system contract entrypoints are raised significantly (10k motes -> 2.5 CSPR or more depending on complexity).

This PR changes fee_handling and refund_handling to be consistent with 1.5.x settings (refund 99% and pay to proposer)

#5047

candidates.body: Backfilling execution_engine backlog. Fixing json serialization issue in StoredValue::SmartContract, applying minor code fixes

candidates.title: Custom Payment QoL
candidates.body: This PR adds a guardrail to improve quality of life for custom payment use case.
